text:
="preserve">Louis Skidmore (April 8, 1897 – September 27, 1962) was an American architect. He was born in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. He was the co-founder of the architecture firm Skidmore, Owings & Merrill and recipient of the AIA Gold Medal.
Skidmore died on September 27, 1962 in Winter Haven, Florida, aged 65.
